title: Tenant details
content:
The tenant details form in Suite Administration contains the following tabs.

General

Field Description
ID Tenant ID.
Name Tenant name.
URL The URL to access this tenant.
Custom domain The custom fully qualified domain name for this tenant such as mytenant.example.com. By doing this, users no longer need to type the tenant ID in the URL to access the tenant.

The custom domain must be at least a third level domain such as mytenant.example.com. In other words, example.com isn't supported.

Note: You can identify a tenant by the custom domain, and therefore must be unique and different from the external access host name of the suite (<External_Access_Host>).

For detailed procedures, see Configure custom domains for tenants.
Type Tenant type.
Environment

Tenant environment:

  • Prod
  • Test
  • Staging
  • Poc
  • RND
  • Unknown
  • DR
Backend type The backend type of the tenant.
Default login type Login type:
  • DB
  • LDAP
  • SAML
  • OAUTH

When you select a default login type, the system will use the specified login type for user authentication. However, users can still use other authentication types by modifying the URL to set AUTH=DB/LDAP/SAML/OAUTH (for example: https://<External_Access_Host>/saw/ess?TENANTID=xxxxxxxxx&AUTH=SAML).

If this field is empty, the system will check the user by the authentication types configured for the tenant one by one until there is a user match. However, when you configure both the SAML and OAuth authentications for the tenant, the system will only try the OAuth authentication. If the OAuth authentication fails, the system won't try the SAML authentication.

Notes:

  • The OAUTH option is only available for tenants with the 1 tier tenancy model (that's, tenants created in 2020.05 or later, and tenants migrated to the 1 tier tenancy model.)
  • For the Service Manager tenant, don't select OAUTH because Service Manager doesn't support the OAuth authentication at the moment.
Public service

Defines which users of the account can access this tenant.

  • If this switch is on, all users of the account can access the tenant.

  • If this switch is off, only specified users of the account can access the tenant. Go to the Users tab to specify the users.

After you change this setting, make sure that you click Hard sync user on the toolbar.
Manage users in tenant

This option is available for a Service Management tenant only. 

This switch is on by default to enable the tenant admin to manage users in this tenant. That's, the tenant admin can unlock users, trigger password reset emails, change the person type, and create users in the agent interface of the tenant.

You can change this setting when the tenant is in New or Active status. To see the changes you can refresh the page or login again to the agent interface.

This setting is only available in a Service Management tenant.
Account The account specified for this tenant. Users that belong to this account can access this tenant.

This field is editable only for the tenant created before the 2020.05 release.
Tenant admin

Tenant admin. You can deploy a tenant with a tenant admin specified. The tenant admin receives an email notification after the successful deployment of the tenant.

Service Management automatically assigns the Tenant admin role to the specified tenant admin.
Owner Tenant owner.
Created by The user who created the tenant.
Description The description captures the details of the tenant.
Creation time The time of tenant creation.
Activate date The date of tenant activation.
Last update on The time of the last update.

IdM settings

 The IdM settings tab is only available for tenants with the 1 tier tenancy model (that's, tenants created in 2020.05 or later, and tenants migrated to the 1 tier tenancy model). 

When you click the IdM settings tab, the system opens the authentication configuration page in the IdM Admin Portal of the suite. You can then add or edit authentication configurations (LDAP, SAML, and OAuth) and configuration groups. For details, see Configure authentication in IdM Admin Portal.

In addition, you can also configure password policy settings for tenants with the 1 tier tenancy model in the IdM Admin Portal. To do this, go to the Password Policy tab in the IdM Admin Portal.

Note: For DB user creation, it's recommended that you do it in Suite Administration instead of in the IdM Admin Portal.

Users

This tab displays the users who have access to this tenant. If Public service is off, you need to click Attach to specify the users that can access this tenant here. For suite admin users to access this tenant, click Attach suite admin users.

Note: If you specify the default login type for a tenant in IdM, the attached suite admin users can't log in to the tenant. For the attached suite admin users to access the tenant, don't configure the default login type.

Service Manager Settings

This tab is available only for a Service Manager tenant.
Field Description
Service Manager settings
Service Manager application version The application version of the external Service Manager.
Service Manager URL

The Service Manager URL in this format: http(s)://<Service Manager server FQDN>:<port> (don't use the IP address). For example, http://mysmserver.com:13080 or https://mysmserver.com:13443.

It's recommended that you set the tenant to Inactive before changing the Service Manager URL.
Service Manager username The user name of a Service Manager user account with the following privileges:
  • "system administrator" security role
  • "RESTful API" capability word
  • Unlimited sessions allowed
Service Manager password The password of the Service Manager user account.
Smart Analytics server URL

The URL of the external Smart Analytics server. For example: http(s)://myidolserver.com:9000.

We recommend that you set the tenant to Inactive before changing the Smart Analytics server URL field.

After changing this field, make sure you restart the Smart Analytics search service. To do this, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to the control plane node as the root or a sudo user.
  2. Run the kubectl get pod -n <namespaces> | grep search command to get the pod name smarta-search.
  3. Run the kubectl delete pod smarta-search-**-** -n <namespaces> command to restart the Smart Analytics search service.
Authentication Type

Authentication type:

  • LWSSO (default)
  • IdM

Note: If you configured Custom domain for the tenant, you can only use IdM as the authentication type.
Service Manager chat settings
SM database type SM database type: SQL Server, Oracle, or PostgreSQL.
SM database host/IP SM database host name or IP address.
SM database port

SM database port. If you have multiple database instances on your Microsoft SQL server, make sure that you use the port number of the database instance for SM. The default port number is 1433 for SQL Server, 5432 for PostgreSQL, and 1521 for Oracle.
SM database name SM database name. If you use a private schema for PostgreSQL, use the currentSchema parameter to append the private schema name to the database name. For example, smpgdb?currentSchema=sm. If you use an Oracle database, use the service name instead of the System ID.
SM database account

The SM database user name.
SM database password The password for the SM database account.
Enable SSL (PostgreSQL only) If your PostgreSQL server requires TLS connection, you need to switch this button to On, make a copy of the CA certificate of your PostgreSQL server, rename it to smpgroot.crt and then, if you're using a classic deployment, upload it to the /var/vols/itom/itsma/global-volume/certificate/smpgcert/ directory on the control plane node. For Helm deployments, refer to Import CA certificate into the Suite for steps on how to upload the certificate.
SSL mode (PostgreSQL only) If your PostgreSQL server requires TLS connection, you can specify whether to use verify-ca or verify-full to verify the server.
ActiveMQ username The ActiveMQ username for integration with Microsoft Skype for Business.
ActiveMQ password The password of the ActiveMQ user.
Chat enabled Information that indicates whether you have enabled the chat.

You can enable Chat in only one Service Manager tenant. That's if you already have Chat enabled in a Service Manager tenant when you enable Chat in a different Service Manager tenant, Chat is automatically disabled for the previous Service Manager tenant.
Two-way TLS settings
Two-way TLS enabled

Specify whether two-way TLS is enabled. Once enabled, configure the following settings:

  • KeyStore file: The Client key store file.
  • KeyStore type: The type of the key store: JKS or PKCS12.
  • KeyStore provider: The provider for the key store. The value of this field depends on the KeyStore type: SUN for JKS and SunJSSE for PKCS12.
  • KeyStore password: The client key store password used to access the client key store.
  • Key alias: The client key store alias that identifies the key in the key store. 
  • Key password: The password used to access the key in the key store. 

For more information about two-way TLS configuration, see Configure TLS for two-way authentication in the SMA-SM help center.

Note: You can not modify the following fields when the tenant is in Active status:

  • SM database type
  • SM database host
  • SM database port
  • SM database name.

Licenses

This tab is available only for a Service Management tenant.

This tab displays the license assignments of this tenant.

Assign a license

To add a license assignment to this tenant, click Add, specify the license pool, select a license to get the remaining capacity, and then assign the available capacity to this tenant.

Don't assign licenses in any of the following combinations to the same tenant:
  • Both a Service Management license (Express or Premium) and an Asset Management license (if you try to do this, an error occurs)
  • Both a Service Management Express license and a Premium license

Revoke a license

To revoke the license, click Revoke. You can revoke the license only when the tenant is active.

When you as the suite admin revoke licenses, note that revoking licenses also removes the corresponding experience modes in Service Management. If you revoke all the licenses in the tenant, the system automatically removes all experience modes in Service Management, which means all menu items become invisible in the tenant except Administration > Configuration > Application Settings. For more information, see Experience mode.

Shared service

This tab displays a tenant's shared service type.


This tab is only available for a Service Management tenant.
You can edit the shared service type only if you have created the tenant before the 2020.05 release.
Shared service type Shared service tab
Standard tenant This tab displays the shared service type
Managed tenant This tab displays the shared service type and its provider tenant.
Provider tenant You can use this tab to manage the managed tenants and grant user permissions. For more information, see Suite Administration for shared service providers.

Capability settings

This tab displays a tenant's capabilities and capability configurations.

This tab is only available for a Service Management tenant.

Add the OO capability

If Operations Orchestration (OO) Containerized is installed in your environment, you need to deploy and enable the OO capability in Suite Administration before you can use OO Containerized with Service Management. For details, see Deploy OO Containerized capability in Suite Administration.

Add the DND capability

To deploy a new capability, click Deploy new capability, configure as required in the prompt window, and then click Deploy. You can't remove the capability once you click Deploy. After you deploy a new capability successfully, you can enable it by turning on the Enable capability toggle. For the detailed steps to deploy and enable the DND capability, see Deploy DND.

If any DND admin or transport users reset their passwords after DND deployment, the suite admin needs to update the available credentials in the Capability settings tab. To update a password, enter the new password of the user and click SAVE. Click CONFIRM in the pop-up window to save the password. Note that it will take several minutes to apply the changes. During this time, the DND related pods in this tenant are unavailable.

Add the Cloud Cost Reporting capability

To add the Cloud Cost Reporting capability, click Deploy new capability, configure as required in the prompt up window, and then click Deploy. You can't remove the capability once you click Deploy. After you deploy a new capability successfully, you can enable it by turning on the Enable capability toggle. For the detailed steps to deploy and enable the Cloud Cost Reporting capability, see Enable Cloud Cost Reporting.

Add the SAM capability

After you install the suite, you can enable SAM in Service Management. For more information about how to deploy and enable the SAM capability, see Enable SAM.

If the UCMDB user of the tenant resets the password after SAM deployment, the suite admin needs to update the recorded credentials in the Capability settings tab. To update a password, simply enter the new password of a specific user and click SAVE. Click CONFIRM in the pop-up window to save the new password. Note that it will take several minutes to apply the changes. During this time, the SAM related pod in this tenant is unavailable.

 

Application settings

This tab is only available for a Service Management tenant.

This tab contains the following sections.

File settings

The File settings section displays the following file settings of a tenant. All changes in file settings take up to 10 minutes to take effect, except that changes made to the Max Dev2Prod package file size (MB) setting take effect immediately. Click   Save in the toolbar to save the changes on file settings.

Max file size (MB)

This setting defines the maximum attachment size the system allows in this tenant. You can't upload any attachments if you enter 0. You can upload attachments of all file sizes if you leave this field empty. Additionally, the system will ignore the Max file size setting if its value is greater than 100 MB. 

When you import a CSV file from the agent portal, the maximum size of the CSV file is shown in the following table. 

Record type Scenario Maximum CSV file size Ignore the "Max file size" value?
device, license, infrastructure & peripheral

When you navigate to:

Service Asset & Configuration > SACM Home > Devices > More > Import CSV

Service Asset & Configuration > SACM Home >Infrastructure & Peripherals > More > Import CSV

Software Asset > Licenses > More > Import CSV

 10 MB Yes
device, license, infrastructure & peripheral, person, or group When you navigate to Administration > Configuration > Studio > (record type> Import data

10 MB

See Import data)

 Yes
Other than above When you navigate to Administration > Configuration > Studio > (record type> Import data 10 MB or the Max file size value (whichever is smaller)
See Import data)		 Yes when the value is larger than 10 MB

Max total file size for email attachments (MB)

This setting defines the maximum total allowed size of attachments that agent users can send from a record by using the Send by email option. Currently, only Change, Purchase order, Request, and Incident support sending emails with attachments. The value must be a positive integer from 1 to 20. The default value is 5 MB.

Max Dev2Prod package file size (MB)

This setting defines the maximum package (.pkb) file size allowed for running an import (including an import simulation) in this tenant by using the Dev2Prod functionality. The value must be a positive integer. You can't import any packages if you enter 0. If you leave this setting empty, the system will bypass the file size checking when you run an import. This setting doesn't take effect when you export system configurations and data to a package file (.pkb). 
Note: The maximum size of a .pkb file attached to a record depends on the Max file size setting. If a .pkb file contains catalog data, each attachment file of a catalog record is also controlled by the Max file size setting. 

Attachment allowlist

This setting defines the attachment file types allowed in this tenant. Use a comma to separate the file types. If you leave this field empty, users can't submit any types of attachments. If you have modified the allowlist, the RESTORE DEFAULT button enables you to restore the default allowlist. 

By allowing users to add all file sizes or all file types to the system, you are disabling or bypassing security features, thereby exposing the system to increased security risks. By using this option, you understand and agree to assume all associated risks and hold OpenText harmless for the same.

In case you change the file sizes or types from their default configuration, OpenText encourages you to add relevant protection measures to protect against risks associated with new file sizes and types. By not implementing relevant protection measures you may be exposing the system to increased security risks. Also, OpenText encourages you to run file content validation, which isn't provided by OpenText, to remove any malicious scripts and viruses from files before uploading them. By not implementing file content validation, you may be exposing the system to increased security risks. You understand and agree to assume all associated risks and hold OpenText harmless for the same. It remains the Customer’s sole responsibility to assess its own regulatory and business requirements. OpenText doesn't represent or warrant that its products comply with any specific legal or regulatory standards applicable to Customer in conducting Customer's business.

Archive file types (.zip, .tar, .gz, .7z, and .rar) are no longer on the attachment allowlist by default. Therefore, the following features that transfer data through .zip files may not function correctly without adjustments to the attachment allowlist.

  • Translation importing for offerings, articles, and surveys
  • Knowledge importing
  • Data domains importing

To use these features it's recommended that you temporarily add the .zip file type to the attachment allowlist and then remove it after you finish the task.

Pay attention to the following:

  • From the UI and through REST calls, you can upload files to the system according to the Attachment allowlist. You can not upload files without an extension from both the UI and through REST calls.

  • You can only upload files of type bmp, jpeg, png, gif, and avif as your profile image in the agent interface or Service Portal. You can not upload any other file type.

    Due to a known limitation, .avif images can't be properly displayed in rich-text fields or profile images in Firefox. In addition, if .avif images are embedded in an email body, they can't be properly displayed in Outlook.

  • By default, the allowlist includes the eml extension. If you want to set up the email integration, don't delete it from the allowlist.

Configuration Management settings

The Configuration Management settings section contains the settings to enable the Native SACM solution.

To enable Native SACM, follow these steps:

Note: The current push adapter in UCMDB is no longer supported when Native SACM is active in a tenant.

  1. Change the Native SACM enabled setting to Yes.

  2. Configure the following Native SACM settings:

    Note: The combination of the UCMDB gateway URL and the UCMDB customer ID must be unique in a suite environment and you can only use it for one tenant.
    • UCMDB gateway service: The URL of the UCMDB Gateway server. Enter a URL in this format: http(s)://<FQDN>:<port>/cms-gateway. For example: https://cmsdemo01.microfocus.net:3000/cms-gateway
    • UCMDB customer ID: The customer ID of UCMDB.
    • UCMDB username: UCMDB login user who can access the UCMDB database.
    • UCMDB password: Password for the UCMDB login user.
  3. Click TEST CONNECTION to verify if your Native SACM settings are correct. Make changes based on the test results.
  4. Click Save in this section to save the native SACM changes.

Tuning settings

The Tuning settings section enables you to configure the following settings for performance tuning. Click Save in this section to save the changes on tuning settings.

Setting Description
BI sync storage quota (GB) Set storage quota for BI sync data. The quota set is 10 by default. The quota range is from 0 to 300.
Maximum history export size (normal user) Set the maximum number of history records that you can export with the normal user permission.
Maximum history export size (admin user) Set the maximum number of history records that you can export with the admin user permission.
Maximum query size Set the maximum number of queries. The size range is from 4,000 to 100,000.
Maximum bulk update size Set the maximum size of each bulk update. The size range is from 250 to 2,000.
Report quota Set the maximum number of report quota points. The range is from 1095000 through 3650000. See Report quota management.
Maximum record size in DSL Set the maximum number of records that you can integrate through DSL. This value range is from 250 to 2,000.
Enable daily VACUUM Enable daily VACUUM for SLT data. By default, it's enabled.
VACUUM execution time Set the time to trigger the daily VACUUM. By default, the system will trigger VACUUM at midnight (00:00 AM).
Enable hourly on-demand VACUUM When enabled, Service Management monitors the count of PostgreSQL dead tuples on an hourly basis. When you reach or exceed the dead tuple threshold as set below, the system will trigger a VACUUM full for SLT data. It may impact the SLT business for a short period of time. By default, it's disabled.
PostgreSQL dead tuple threshold This value only takes effect when you have enabled the Enable hourly on-demand VACUUM option.
Enable internal audit log Enable this option to write the internal audit log to the tenant audit table. By default, it's enabled.

OData settings

OData API calls are subject to throttling to limit their performance impact. The OData settings section enables you to configure the throttling settings at the tenant level.

Setting Description
Enable OData service

By default, the OData service is enabled to access your Service Management data source.

To disable this feature, select Off.
Maximum number of concurrent requests

Set the maximum number of concurrent REST calls from OData.

Note: 

  • If the number in this parameter is set to 0, then there is no limit.
  • The range of possible values for this parameter: From 0 to 200.
  • If you use Power BI, then before you set this parameter, you need to check Maximum number of simultaneous evaluations in your Power BI Desktop. Make sure the number in this parameter is greater than or equal to the Maximum number of simultaneous evaluations value, so that the data can be pulled successfully,
Maximum number of records per day

Set the maximum number of returned records that can be returned by OData REST calls per day.

Note: 

  • If the number in this parameter is set to 0, then there is no limit.
  • The range of possible values for this parameter: From 0 to infinite.
Maximum page size

Set the maximum number of records returned in a single page from OData using server-side pagination.

Note: The range of possible values for this parameter: From 1 to 10,000.
Delay time

Set the delay time between subsequent page requests (in milliseconds).

Note: The range of possible values for this parameter: From 0 to 30,000.

Group members sync settings

If you use IdM's group rule functionality to dynamically assign members to groups for capabilities like Cloud Management (DND, CMP FinOps, and Content Store), UCMDB, and Operations Orchestration (OO), you can turn on the "Pull group members from IdM" option to make Service Management periodically pull the group-member relationship established in IdM. Note that the group member sync feature is also controlled at the group level. To use this feature to pull members for a group from IdM, you must also select the "Pull members from IdM" checkbox in the group details.

Use the Pulling interval field to configure the interval at which the Service Management scheduled job pulls group members from IdM.

If the total number of group members for the tenant in IdM is more than 100,000, it is recommended to set the Pulling interval to larger than 24.

Integration Studio settings

The Integration Studio settings section enables you to configure the following Integration Studio-related settings. Click Save in this section to save the changes to these settings.

Setting Description
Maximum rule execution rate for current SMAX Set the maximum number of Integration Studio rules that can be processed in a minute against the current Service Management system. If many rules are triggered simultaneously, newly arriving rules that exceed this limit will be held in a queue for delayed execution to avoid negative performance impact. The allowed range is 100-10,000.
Maximum rule execution rate for target system Set the maximum number of Integration Studio rules that can be processed in a minute against the target system. If many rules are triggered simultaneously, newly arriving rules that exceed this limit will be held in a queue for delayed execution to avoid negative performance impact. The allowed range is 100-10,000.
Maximum request processing rate for listener Set the maximum number of requests from external systems that can be processed by the listener per minute. The listener triggers a configured integration scenario for each of the requests. If many requests are received simultaneously, new requests that exceed this limit will be rejected. The allowed range is 10-1,000.
Maximum request processing rate for synchronous scenario triggering Set the maximum number of synchronous scenario triggering requests that can be processed by Integration Studio per minute. If many requests are received simultaneously, new requests that exceed this limit will be rejected. The allowed range is 10-10,000.
Maximum wait duration in seconds for synchronous scenario triggering request Set the maximum duration in seconds that Integration Studio will wait for a response from a synchronous scenario triggering request. The allowed range is 3-30.
Maximum number of iterations for Do Until rules

Set the maximum number of times that the rules inside any Do Until rule can be executed. The range is 10-10000. When the iteration limit is reached, the system will stop executing further iterations for the Do Until rule and write an error in the rule's execution log. 

OPTIC Switcher settings

OPTIC Switcher is a UI component that allows you to quickly switch between multiple ITOM Applications. See OPTIC Switcher configurations for detailed instructions.

Setting Description
Base URL

Configure the base URL of OPTIC Switcher. For example: https://uis.coloryourdata.io, uis.coloryourdata.io, or https://uis.coloryourdata.io:1234

Note: If you have updated the connect-src directive in CSP settings for this tenant, you also need to add this URL to the connect-src directive. 
Authentication configuration group in IdM Set the name of the authentication configuration group configured in the IdM of OPTIC One (Organization of OPTIC One > Authentication > Configuration Groups)
OPTIC One tenant ID

The ID of the OPTIC One tenant from which OPTIC Switcher is loaded. If the OPTIC One is deployed in a Provider tenant, leave this field empty.

Email Service settings

By default, Enable mail configuration is set to Off, and the tenant uses the global mail configurations defined in the Configurations tab in Suite Administration. 

Set Enable mail configuration to On to configure mail settings specific to this tenant. The mail setting fields are the same as on the Configurations tab in Suite Administration. For details about how to configure these fields, see the "Email service tab" section in Configurations. 

Before clicking Test connection to test the mail server connection, you need to enter the password of the authentication user account even if you have entered it before.  

Operation history

This tab displays the history of the following operations on the tenant:

  • Create tenant

  • Deploy tenant

  • Delete tenant

  • Clone tenant

  • Import tenant

  • Export tenant

  • Update tenant

  • Deploy capability

  • The failed jobs to sync updated managed tenants or managed accounts from Suite Administration to Service Management.

To get the latest status, click Refresh.

Authorization migration

Use this tab to synchronize the following authorization-related data between IdM and the tenant:

  • Groups
  • Roles
  • Relationship between groups and roles
  • Relationship between groups and users
  • Relationship between users and roles
This tab provides the same functionality as the Authorization migration tab in the Configurations module, except that this tab displays more task-level details, such as task status and migration counts. See Authorization migration for more information.
